venue.address_1: Corner of Boston Common at Intersection of Tremont, Park and Winter Streets
venue.name: Park St T Station

item.description:
Start guidebook blurb "The Freedom Trail is one of the most popular walking tours in America and is a great way to see many of the historic landmarks of Boston. Much of the trail meanders through the twisting and curved streets that are the original paths and byways established by the first colonists. The trail starts in Boston Common, heads through the North End and finishes across the river in Charlestown, and at a total of 3 miles in length, it should only take a couple of hours to complete."

Sounds fun! So all you frustrated tourists out there, join us as we the walk the walk and then go for a couple of drinks at the Tavern on the Water in Charlestown. This pub is famous for its great view of the harbour and the make-your-own Bloody Mary bar on Sundays.

Meet at Park St T stop at 1pm, please don't be late. And bring some comfortable shoes.

If anyone wants to meet later for drinks, we should get there around 3-4pm. The address is:
Tavern on the Water
1 Eighth St Ste 6 (Cross Street: First Avenue)
Charlestown, MA 02129-4206

group.name: The Boston Expat Aussie Meetup Group

item.name: Walk The Freedom Trail
